text:
Attempting to run the Apache Tomcat 5.0.16 Installation executable in silent 
mode (using the "/S" argument) immediately results in a dialog stating "No 
Java Virtual Machine found." 

On the same system, I can run the Apache Tomcat 4.1.18 Installation executable 
with the "/S" argument - and it will correctly detect the JVM and silently 
install AT.  

Also, the JVM is correctly detected when I do a manual install even with 
5.0.16. 

Something must have changed between these two revisions to cause the Silent 
Installation to fail in 5.0.16.
creator: porterpe@npt.nuwc.navy.mil
remm@apache.org
text:
I wasn't aware of a silent installation feature. So if this worked, it is only
by accident.
For installing silently, I think .zip files are better overall ...
*** Bug 25955 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
creator: remm@apache.org
porterpe@npt.nuwc.navy.mil
text:
I have changed my installation to use the contents of the .zip file.  You are 
correct that it is easier, and I don't have to worry about trying to suppress 
the message that states which JDK is found or the window that comes up at the 
end of the installation with the Start Menu folder contents.

Also, on uninstallation all I have to do now is remove the files and uninstall 
the service - so they user isnt presented with the message similar to "... 
delete all files in the Apache Tomcat directory..." which has an error in it 
with two words that have no space between them (dont have it in front of me at 
the moment or i would quote it directly).

creator: remm@apache.org
text:
I saw in the latest NSIS that it has improved silent installation features.
Maybe this can be done, but I don't know for sure right now.
